Compliment monster. <br />
<br />
10/10<br />
<br />
Stephen.r: these kind of rev,. are the complete disaster for a community</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="43037"comment_id="873535"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Roaring-Radcliff-43037.html?ccid=873535#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent827806" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc827806" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="stephen.r"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/986473"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="stephen.r" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/The-Art-Of-Shaving/Sandalwood-and-Cypress-Cologne-Intense-42173.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.42173.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sandalwood and Cypress Cologne Intense"title="Sandalwood and Cypress Cologne Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma827806ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd827806" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/986473">stephen.r</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-05-31">05/31/17 08:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Close your eyes...<br />
<br />
Imagine now, standing at a urinol in the men's bathroom doing your thing while chewing a piece of black licorice.  You inhale to get a whiff of both at the same time.  Perhaps even, you are wearing the same shirt that you spilled whiskey on the night before at a smoky cigar bar.  The word vile is probably too nice for this fragrance. It is strong, hard to wash off and repulsive.  Very un-Penhaligon's. <br />
<br />
A complete disaster.  If this is the way the house fixes performance issues, time to find another house.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="43037"comment_id="827806"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Roaring-Radcliff-43037.html?ccid=827806#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent816969" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc816969" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gtabasso"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/132621"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.132621.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gtabasso" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/True-Lust-Rayon-Violet-De-Ses-Yeux-29397.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.29397.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="True Lust Rayon Violet De Ses Yeux"title="True Lust Rayon Violet De Ses Yeux"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma816969ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd816969" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/132621">gtabasso</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-27">04/27/17 04:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love this. It has citrus in the top but quickly leaves to become a soft, powdery tobacco with a hint of sweetness. The honey is not prominent. It's there but not in a sickening sweet way. This entire Portraits line reminds me of Histoiries de Parfums. That kind of soft, powdery base. Of those I've tried so far, this is my favorite. It is not boring, gourmand or boisterous. In the complete dry down there is serious musk or civet. Six hours later: like vintage Habanita had sex with Salome.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="43037"comment_id="816969"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Roaring-Radcliff-43037.html?ccid=816969#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">

<br />
They are very similar; however I prefere Radcliff, it is a bit smoother, and you can smell some woody notes in the background.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="43037"comment_id="1222495"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Roaring-Radcliff-43037.html?ccid=1222495#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1233873" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1233873" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cam59"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1258168"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cam59" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1233873ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1233873" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1258168">Cam59</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-10-07">10/07/20 11:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My favorite fragrance. The dry down is soft but beautiful. I think this will be my signature scent. It is a sophisticated scent with a playful side. Scent off my skin and clothes is magical. I will respray just out of love for the scent. I cannot get enough of it. That warm gingerbread smell in the dry down is gorgeous. It wafts to the nose and I feel transformed. I cannot relate to comparisons to TF's TV. I cannot stand that scent. Yes, RR is on the expensive side but it's worth to me.<br />
<br />
10/10 scent</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="43037"comment_id="1233873"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Roaring-Radcliff-43037.html?ccid=1233873#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1783063" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1783063" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vikkinca"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1345893"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1345893.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vikkinca" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1783063ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1783063" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1345893">Vikkinca</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-14">03/14/23 04:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A review of a clone of Roaring Radcliff called Georgian's The Lion Heart by Armaf:<br />
<br />
Fragrance Note Pyramid:<br />
Top: Bergamot, Cinnamon.<br />
Middle: Tobacco, Ginger, Rose.<br />
Base: Honey, Tonka, Amber Wood, Leather.<br />
<br />
Bottle Size: 100ml.<br />
Price: $38.<br />
<br />
This moves from Tobacco Vanille to Naxos to Herod. Yes, I know, I know. That sounds great, doesn't it😊 <br />
<br />
On first spray you're thinking this is just another take on Tobacco Vanille - a lighter, sweeter, less linear version. Wait about two hours and you start smelling the honey and cinnamon more prominently, balancing out the scent of tobacco. The sweetness is reminiscent of Naxos. In the late dry-down it might be the rose and Tonka bean that lifts the scent to something akin to Herod. I know there's no rose note in Herod, but the way it's blended here, it appears to be the note - along with the Tonka bean I suspect - that transitions the honeyed tobacco to a scent quite close to Herod. All the while maintaining that Tobacco Vanille backbone.<br />
<br />
I must've sniffed both my arms a thousand times; it is that beautiful a fragrance. I'd say more masculine. Georgian's The Lion Heart lasts at least 12 hours - I was still smelling it on me long after I'd showered. Certainly not redundant if you love tobacco fragrances, like I do, or if you have any or all of the three others I have mentioned in my review. <br />
<br />
A magical clone of Roaring Radcliff in scent and presentation✨</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="43037"comment_id="1783063"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Roaring-Radcliff-43037.html?ccid=1783063#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1241294" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1241294" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chicago Tony T"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/773746"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.773746.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chicago Tony T" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rasasi/Daarej-pour-Homme-19688.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.19688.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Daarej pour Homme"title="Daarej pour Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1241294ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1241294" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/773746">Chicago Tony T</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-10-25">10/25/20 17:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Performance is the biggest issue with this fragrance. The smell is a perfect 10 but lacks any depth as longevity and sillage at best is moderate. You can pretty much look at this as a Tobacco Vanille Fraiche.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="43037"comment_id="1241294"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Roaring-Radcliff-43037.html?ccid=1241294#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1281317" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1281317" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="uno"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1263873"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1263873.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="uno" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1281317ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1281317" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); I have tested Tobacco Vanilla that many reviewers have said similar to Radcliffe. I don't get such similarity. And I prefer Radcliffe.<br />
Good for men and women.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="43037"comment_id="1281317"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Roaring-Radcliff-43037.html?ccid=1281317#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="43037" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent979669" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc979669" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="F2097"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="F2097" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma979669ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd979669" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212">F2097</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-09-07">09/07/18 12:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Over-composed to the point where it turns into a mess. A horrible grey, playdoh fennel scented, unpleasant experience.<br />
<br />
I feel there are too many of these portrait fragrances now. A lot of them are quite generic and don't seem very much like the classic Penhaligon fragrances.<br />
<br />
Most of them are well made, Lord George and Sohan are the highlights, a lot of the others are passable or have likeable elements.<br />
<br />
This one starts off ok, an over fussy floral. Later it developed into something that seemed like it was trying to be everything at once but failing at it. Metallic, marine, honey, tobacco, floral, aniseed, fruity, it is just too much and too badly composed.<br />
<br />
Like in Nausica where the giant world destroying monster is revived, but too early and it just melts and dies.<br />
<br />
Here we are at the bottom of the barrel. Hopefully Penhaligons will slow down or move on from all these portrait fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="43037"comment_id="979669"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Roaring-Radcliff-43037.html?ccid=979669#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent935427" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc935427" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wxmath"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1040946"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1040946.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="wxmath" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nishane/Ani-54785.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54785.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ani"title="Ani"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma935427ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd935427" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1040946">wxmath</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-04-22">04/22/18 13:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I had high expectations based on you tube reviews. Not sweet, somewhat smokey on my skin. Not what I expected from the note breakdown. This combines with poor longevity and sillage doesn't make this a bottle worthy purchase.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="43037"comment_id="935427"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Roaring-Radcliff-43037.html?ccid=935427#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1283379" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1283379" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Drcoyle34"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1212752"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Drcoyle34" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1283379ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1283379" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1212752">Drcoyle34</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-28">01/28/21 15:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is quite to scent to unpack. I'm writing my review based on the Oil Impression version from Oil Perfumery. I've smelled a sample of the original and it's spot on. Now for the review.. this is a great scent hands down! It's pretty potent off the bat with the rum, ginger, cinnamon, and beeswax slapping you in the face.  Its a darker mysterious and sophisticated scent imo. After about 2-4hrs or so, it begins to settle nicely and you start to smell more of the rose, gingerbread scent, tobacco, and honey come through. Longevity? 10+ hrs easily for me.<br />
<br />
This pretty much stays with hints of leather and tonka drifting by your nose. This is definitely a fall/winter scent. If you have cool spring nights where you live, then it'll work then too. This is a manly scent and I've gotten several compliments from ladies at work and out. Its my best winter scent to date. Fellas, if you are cooking dinner for your lady or on a night out, put on alil of this (neck/chest area). 4-6 hours later, she'll want to gobble you up lol. Don't sleep on it. Enjoy!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="43037"comment_id="1283379"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Roaring-Radcliff-43037.html?ccid=1283379#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent971994" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc971994" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tlund"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/119796"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.119796.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tlund" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Comme-des-Garcons/Comme-des-Garcons-2-390.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.390.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Comme des Garcons 2"title="Comme des Garcons 2"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma971994ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd971994" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/119796">Tlund</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-08-15">08/15/18 10:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I agree with Jamie81 it is similar to Chergui.  Despite what others have said, the HONEY IS PROMINENT and in A VERY SWEET WAY. Not sure how I feel about it yet, but sweet honey and baby powder is really not my thing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="43037"comment_id="971994"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Roaring-Radcliff-43037.html?ccid=971994#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1718404" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1718404" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lithohydrobio"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1237458"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1237458.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lithohydrobio" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/DS-Durga/Salem-Gothic-86328.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.86328.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Salem Gothic"title="Salem Gothic"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1718404ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1718404" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); Profile wise it Reminds me of Ralph Lauren Chaps from the 70s but chaps is better.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="43037"comment_id="1718404"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Roaring-Radcliff-43037.html?ccid=1718404#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="43037" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>

        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">58.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Zoologist-Perfumes.html" class="en2inter">Zoologist Perfumes</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">59.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Juliette-Has-A-Gun.html" class="en2inter">Juliette Has A Gun</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">60.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Roja-Dove.html" class="en2inter">Roja Dove</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            </div>
        </div>

    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
